newsitem.title: USA: Pinnacle Micro sees Q2 loss of $5 mln.
newsitem.headline: Pinnacle Micro sees Q2 loss of $5 mln.

text.p: Pinnacle Micro Inc said Tuesday it expects to report a loss of about $5 million for the second quarter of fiscal 1997 because of an expected decrease in revenues from the first quarter.
The company said second quarter revenues will be about $11 million compared to $14.1 million for the first quarter.
The company also said it has hired the consulting firm Kibel, Green Inc and the law firm of Lobel & Opera to help it deal with various creditors.
Pinnacle said chairman Daryl White resigned on June 20.
In addition, it hired the investment banking firm Houlihan, Lokey, Howard & Zukin to help it evaluate alternatives, including possibly locating a financial or industry partner or other deal.

The company said it is having difficulty paying trade debt on a timely basis and has tentatively scheduled a meeting with its vendors for July 14 to discuss various alternatives and to seek the cooperation of its creditors in a possible restructuring of its trade debt.
